Posts.Content: Thank you for your note on PSA spikes. I recently had a PSA spike from 3.6 to 6 in a six month span. I have a appointment with my Urologist to discuss further and needless to say I am worried about the big spike. I'm praying its just an infection and not PC that was missed in a 2012 biopsy.
Posts.Title: PSA jump

Posts.Content: Thanks Chuck, good advice. I was a little surprised by his low key, non-chalant demeanor but he's the expert not me. I just told him that I wanted to be pro-active and was willing to take whatever tests were needed to catch PC early if I ever get it.
Posts.Title: Continued elevated PSA test scores

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Last year (August, 2012) I joined this forum and made my first post. Here is a recap of my story: * I am 48 years old. Last year on 7/29/12 I went for my annual physical and my doctor ordered a PSA blood test. * The following is a history of my previous PSA blood tests: 7/29/12 - PSA 2.89 (first PSA test ever) 7/31/12 - PSA 3.24, placed on antibitoics (Ciprofloxacin) for 10 days 8/13/12 - PSA 3.06 8/20/12 - PSA Free test, PSA 3.28, PSA free 0.56, PSA % free 17 * I am not aware of any prostate issues with my family. My dad and brother are alive and they are not aware of any prostate issues that they might have. * I had a Biopsy done on Fri, 8/24/12 and the results came back negative. Doctor ordered a follow up PSA test in one year. * 10/1/13 - Follow up PSA test came back at 3.9 I recevied a call from my new urologist doctor (the doctor that performed the biopsy last year retired). Since my PSA is still high and has increased from last year they have scheduled an appointment for me this coming week to discuss my options. The urologist department is saying that since this is the 5th PSA test with abnormal readings and rising that there is cause for some concern and they want to confirm there is no other underlying factors for the high readings. I was very anxious last year during all of these tests and was very relieved that my biopsy results came back negative. Now I am nervous and scared all over again. My biggest fear is that somehow I now have PC and it is in advanced stages. Am I thinking to much into this (I tend to worry to much)? Based on the information above am I way off base and thinking to negatively? Any suggestions, feedback, advice and potential questions to ask my new urology doctor would be greatly appreciated. Thank you and God bless all of you. Israel
Posts.Title: Continued elevated PSA test scores

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by njs Well its definitely good that he wants to monitor your PSA closely, although I'm a little surprised he wouldn't want to try antibiotics again (but for more than 10 days) to test for a likely benign cause for the increase. The DRE result is good but definitely doesn't rule out possible PC. Because you've had a negative biopsy the PCA3 urine test could be an appropriate next step to consider at some point if PSA does remain high. But since he wants to see you again in 3 months, I don't think there is any need to get too anxious about the "inaction" at this point but you can discuss further action next time if it remains high. Good luck. Thanks NJS, good advice. On one hand I'm gad to hear that he felt I'm ok, but I do want to stay proactive. I asked for a PSA free test and he said it wasnt necessary at this point. He also said they do not offer the PCA3 urine test and even if they did he doesn't recomend it at this point. He said for me to do PSA blood tests every three months and then come back and see him in one year. Unless the PSA readings double or something big like that then he would see me sooner. He did say that he wants to limit the number of biopsies unless he really feels I need them.
Posts.Title: Continued elevated PSA test scores

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I will be 51 in July. Back in 2012 I had elevated PSA levels in the 3.3 range. I had a biopsy and it came back negative. Since then I have been taking periodic PSA tests (around every six months) and they have been in the 3.6 range. Last week I had my latest PSA blood test and it spiked up to 6. I have scheduled an appt. with my Urologist for this Wed, 3/16. Needless to say my anxiety level has spiked as well. Anything specific I should be asking my Urologist? Thanks everyone in advance for any advice you can share.
Posts.Title: Big spike in PSA level - worried

Posts.Content: Thank you for the feedback. I will make sure and ask my urologist about this. I am glad to see that you were able to detect your PC early enough and doing well. Originally Posted by ddayglo Some urologists would recommend another biopsy... But consider asking your urologist about a course of antibiotics, and PSA retest, and a T3-MRI first....

Posts.Title: Continued elevated PSA test scores

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, update from my appointment today with my new urologist. He said the appt. today was more for me to meet him (since he is replacing my old urologist who retired) and not so much my PSA score (3.9). He said he was not that concern with the reading. He will have me do a PSA test every three months just to make sure it doesn't keep treading up or spike. He did a DRE and confirmed my prostate was enlarged but that it felt normal. Does all this sound reasonable? Does this sound like reasonable advice or should I get a second opinion? Thanks.
Posts.Title: Continued elevated PSA test scores

Posts.Title: Continued elevated PSA test scores

Posts.Content: Thanks Michael, your suggestions are very helpful and I will definitely bring them up with my Urologist. I think they mentioned BPH before but not prostatitis. I will have to double check tomorrow. My big concern is the PSA spike and that somehow my 2012 biopsy did not detect PC and it has been growing since. I am glad to see you caught your PC early enough and were able to treat it accordingly. Originally Posted by Michael F Hi Garza! We understand your concerns!!! Your PSA is elevated and needs to be investigated. There are conditions, including prostate cancer (PC) that can cause PSA elevations. You did not mention if you have BPH or prostatitis. These can cause elevated PSAs. Your negative biopsy in 2012 is encouraging; however, it is possible for biopsies to "miss" PC. It is also possible that PC has either since developed or progressed. Seeing the Uro tomorrow is definitely the right course of action. He/she will likely do a thorough exam to narrow down the possible causes of your elevated PSA. Questions/Issues you may want to discuss, if PC is suspected or needs to be ruled out are: - Can a Multiparametric 3T MRI detect any areas of suspicion? - Can this MRI be "fused" with a future TRUS Biopsy to help 'guide' the biopsy needles to areas of suspicion? - PSAFT test. The ratio of Free PSA/Bound PSA will indicate the "risk" probability of PC - PCA3 test. Following an aggressive DRE, a urine sample is collected. The result will also indicate the "risk" probability of PC. Meanwhile, try to relax, stay calm, and be optimistic! Hoping you will not qualify for membership to this Club! Good luck & keep us updated! MF
Posts.Title: Big spike in PSA level - worried

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Here's my story. I am Mexican-American and just turned 47 this past July. I went to my doctor for my annual physical (7/29) and all my normal bloodwork and exams went well. For whatever reason, my doctor also ordered a PSA blood test for me. My first reading came in at 2.89. My doctor had me re-take the PSA test and it came in at 3.24. She put me on antibitoics (Ciprofloxacin) for 10 days and my third PSA test came in at 3.06. I am not aware of any prostate issues with my family. My dad and brother are alive and have never mentioned any prostate issues with me. I have been very worried since my doctor told me about the first elevated PSA test. I was scheduled for a biopsy this afternoon (8/16) but my doctor had to cancel his afternoon appointments for a surgery emergency. It has been rescheduled for next Fri, 8/24. A few days ago my lower back started to hurt and my anxiety has risen since I have read that this is one of the symptoms of advanced prostate cancer and that the antibiotics did not reduce my PSA level. I can't believe I have to wait another week to see if I have cancer or not. My biggest fear is that I have had prostate cancer for a number of years with no symptoms and now it has advanced with no cure and starting to feel the symptoms. I'm married with two boys and I am scared of leaving them so soon. Any advice or phone numbers that I can call for peer advice would be appreciated. Thank you.
Posts.Title: Elevated PSA - nervous

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I got the results of my PSA free blood work today. The results were as follows: PSA free - 0.56 PSA - 3.28 PSA % Free - 17 Are these numbers good, bad or ok? Does the PSA % free number of 17 help to alleviate my fears of possibly having advanced prostate cancer? I'm still nervous for my biopsy this Fri, 8/24 and getting the results for it. Any feedback is greatly appreciated.
Posts.Title: Elevated PSA - nervous

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Thank you again for your invaluble insights and positive thoughts. I had my appt. today with my regular doctor for a DRE. Before the exam she stated "I hope I find an enlarged prostate". Not sure why she said that? Is that a good thing? She did the exam and gave me the following feedback: 1. My prostate was definately enlarged but she could not tell me the current size. 2. Is was asymetrically ok (both sides even). 3. The prostate felt ok with no hard lumps or lobes. Does this feedback mean anything? I asked for the following additional tests be done: Free PSA blood test, PAP blood test and a PCA3 urine test. They only allowed me to take the free PSA blood test. I hope to get the results by this Thursday.
Posts.Title: Elevated PSA - nervous

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Thank you for taking the time to respond to my initial post. I have scheduled a follow up visit for tomorrow (Mon, 8/20) with my primary doctor to check out my back pain and perform a prostate exam. My doctor ordered a PSA test during my physical exam but did not do a prostate exam at the time. I have asked for the exam in hopes of trying to get more info. prior to my biopsy scheduled for Fri, 8/24. Here is some additional info. * I spoke with my dad and asked him if ever had cancer or was tested. He said he had a "colonoscopy" done two years ago and everything came back ok. He says he has had physicals in the past with everything coming out ok but I'm not sure if he had PSA tests done. * The PSA reading of 2.89 was the first PSA reading I ever had. * The Biopsy I have scheduled for this coming Fri, 8/24 is being done by Dr. Daniel Gordan Smiley, MD in the Kaiser - Urologic Surgery Dept. in San Diego, CA. (how do I find out more info. about him? I was originally scheduled to have the biospy done with Dr. Eric William Gerber, MD.) * I have not had any urination problems, my only symptom is the lower back pain I started to have last week. I'm still trying to stay positive and your posts and this blog has helped. Thanks again and will keep you updated.
Posts.Title: Elevated PSA - nervous

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I got the results of my PSA free blood work today. The results were as follows: PSA free - 0.56 PSA - 3.28 PSA % Free - 17 Are these numbers good, bad or ok? Does the PSA % free number of 17 help to alleviate my fears of possibly having advanced prostate cancer? I'm still nervous for my biopsy this Fri, 8/24 and getting the results for it. Any feedback is greatly appreciated.
